This anime hits a bit too close to home, I don't know what to SAY 😅 .It's relatable. The strongest thing that painful stories have is that people who have felt similar pain can relate to the main character, when that occurs a person can easily fall in love with a story. If you're someone that is anti-social, socially awkward,OTAKU shy, or can't express yourself well then you'll find Tsutsui Hikari practically reading your mind at several points.
Growing up is not an easy process, and there are always moments that one looks back upon with a sense of embarrassment and regret. One might ask whatit is that truly marks the transition into adulthood: the ability to live independently, or maybe the conformity and adherence to social norms. Are the people who remain true to their self's interested on changing there way's, then? \n\n
Perhaps. But is there anything wrong with that? It's hard to say \n
Perhaps this story is not for everyone .maybe you will like the consapet of an otaku finding true love maybe u will not ,if you r an otaku you will like the story

I don't know why this anime has a low rating when it's already turning out to be one of the best shoujos. The story is of an otaku and a supposedly promiscuous pretty girl. All the characters are quite good (seriously, no annoying characters so far, even the villains are enjoyable), the progression is great! Igarashi and Tsutsui are already together by the 1st episode. I'm in the 4th episode now and their story is going strong. It's quite rare for an anime to show a relationship rather than just their usual take of the 'build up'. Also they do not miss the chance toshow affection! hate it when an anime has like 0 kisses but lots of sexual tension. this is super cute and great, please watch it!

Although the story may be kind of predictable I really dont mind it. Also its a romance anime where teh focus is not on how the MCs get into a relationship but rather what problems they have to face while being in one.
I actually like 3D Kanojo even more after every episode I watch. I really love it when the main characters are lovely people. Thats why this anime reminds me of Ore Monagatari or Say I love you.
Also it may be only me but its like Iroha is hiding something or just not telling something about herself which makes me kinda curious to knowwhat it could be. Also its kind of funny watching an anime about an otaku xD 

For an anime with just 12 episodes the story and the relationship developement between the characters arent that bad at all. But ofcaurse sometimes it may appear rushed, which in my opinion is often the case when an anime is under 24 episodes.

All in all I enjoy watching 3D Kanojo.


Well now after I finished the first season there are some things I want to add to my review.

After episode 7 it got a bit boring due to our MCs lack of understanding others and thus not being able to decide whats the best thing to do is. 

In the last 2 episodes a new character and I guess maybe rival to Tsutsui in the future (season 2) appeared. Also we get to see some cute/romatic moments not only from the MCs but also the supporting cast. 


I think 3D Kanojo had more potential but in the end its pretty mediocre. It still is fun to watch but my score definetely dropped after episode 7. I guess because a 2nd season is on the way they left some stuff open so I hope season 2 will be more intresting.

Este anime en particular se basa en la relación amorosa entre un chico, el cuál tiene muy poca autoestima y que ha sido marginado por ser otaku por los demás chicos, y un chica, la cuál es odiada por las demás chicas debido a que tiene fama de ser una roba novios. La historia se centra en los problemas que pasan en su relación, aunque en ciertos puntos también desvía la mirada hacia los personajes secundarios y sus problemas, generalmente amorosos. La mayoría de problemas que sufren la pareja protagonista es debido a la inseguridad y la falta de comunicación del protagonista, el cual debidoa ser marginado por los demás, no puede socializar ni entender a los demás.\n
Aunque el anime no nos aporta nada nuevo y los personajes no dejan ningun peso importante en nosotros, este anime podria considerarse como anime romantico y de comedia con el que pasar el rato. A mi me gusto moderadamente aunque el personaje principal no me llego a gustar sinceramente.\n
Actualmente se espera una segunda temporada de este anime.

Quick review. First this is my first review ever and I came out of my way to do this because of how low rating this anime is. I been watching anime for probably 7+ years so I think this is quite significant for me to do this. 
This is one of my favorite romance anime of all times and I am happy i disregarded the rating. If you don't care about Art, Sound or Story and all you care about is the character and mainly ROMANCE, this is 100% for you. This is a no BS anime with misconceptions, 3rd party person who takes overhalf of the show.... Its literally pure romance. The anime seems low production, maybe some "cringy" things here and there, but like i said, if you are looking for ROMANCE, this is right for you. I have not watched a good romance anime like this in a while. I really hope more people understand and give it a try. I believe this anime is a hit or miss to some people, you either love it or you hate it.  \n
Quick thing on the otaku. I almost didn't watch this because of the otaku stuff.... but I did anyways because I am in need for new animes to watch since I watch so much anime. The character is good.... why? Because they are no blind or anything. The Otaku MC isn't some dumb unrealistic MC from my eyes. And the chick is the same. Her personality and everything is unique and awesome to watch and cute. I myself don't understand or truely know what an otaku is, even though all I do is play games and go to school, but if boobs are in front of my face, I would get em. Most animes that haves these "otakus" completely ignore the boobs and are like 70%  not interested in romance. But this anime is different which is why it is is good. The MC actually develops. \n
Also, there are very few animes out there that are quick date into just development.\n\n
So give it a try if your into purely romance. I have watched this 5+ hours straight yesterday... and this is one of the few animes especially in the drama/romance animes that I did not get bored watching. Don't be deceived by the rating the anime currently has. I give it a 10/10 not because to boost the rating, but for the romance genre, it is a 10/10.
